name: Stealth Labyrinth
description: Stealth Labyrinth is a first-person shooter game based on stealth mechanics. In a sci-fi labyrinth, the player must proceed, room after room, finding the right way until the end, before the time is out and everything explodes and avoiding all guard robot.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel Core i5 4460 equivalent or greater Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GT 430 (no VR) or GTX 960 (VR) DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 1 GB available space

reviews.review_text: This is the worst game I've ever played, although I have not played E.T. the Extraterrestrial on the Atari 2600. The video gets extremely fuzzy off and on, the way a bad signal looked back in the day when you had an antenna, back when tvs were analog. There was even a function that was listed as the wrong button. The worst thing of all, was that the game kept thinking I was in one spot, when I was in a different spot, so it wouldn't let me do anything when I got to a certain room. If you like mediocrity, you'll love this game!
This is not a game, it's an atrocity. Avoid at all cost.
